description.narrative: Strengthening Disaster Risk Reduction and Response Capacities project supports the Government of Tajikitan to undertake a nation-wide risk assessment, establish and implement risk reduction measures and improve early warning

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 User-friendly risk assessment tool developed. 1.2 Weather data collection assessed. 1.3 Weather warning messaging and modalities improved.

comment.narrative: 1.1 The current Risk Assessment Methodology (RAM) is complex and not operating through a digital data processing mode. The RAM risk calculation process is required to be converted into an automatic procedure incorporating the base data (e.g., land use, hazard locations, etc.) 1.2 The number of automatic reporting weather stations are not adequate to produce accurate and reliable weather forecasting. 1.3 Weather forecasting outreach modality is not covering the entire country.

1.1.1 District risk profiles disseminated and awareness rising campaigns conducted. 1.2.1 Identify, prioritize, and implement at least 8 eco-DRR 1.2.2 Finalize implementation of at least 20 risk reduction sub-projects (CoES, ALRI). 1.2.3 Building technical capacity of ALRI 3.2.1 Procurement of SAR equipment for SAR teams.

1.1.1 District risk profiles were printed and disseminated 1.2.1 22,400 seedlings were printed in 69 ha of land in 8 districts 1.2.2 More than 20 risk reduction initiatives were implemented jointly with partners 1.2.3 Technical capacity of ALRI built through provision of dump truck and concrete mixer 3.2.1 Search and rescue capacity of CoES built through provision of equipment

1.1.1 Risk assessments conducted in 58 districts and district risk profiles developed. 1.2.1 Based on the result of the feasibility/risk assessment, 20 DRR sub-projects are designed and implemented. 1.3.1 Installation of meteorological equipment to 10 weather stations completed, and capacity of Agency on Hydrometeorology to produce accurate weather forecast improved. 1.4.1 Severe weather warning system developed. 2.1.1 DRM improvement plans developed in five municipalities (Bohktar, Shaartuz, Kulyab, Khorog, Gharm). 2.2.1 Implementation of the municipality DRM improvement plans in two cities Khujand and Panjakent. 3.1.1 Implementation of the certification process for at least 10 CBDRM SAR teams, and initiation of integration process them into national SAR structure. 3.2.1 SAR in Dushanbe and 4 regional SAR teams’ capacities improved and effectively response to disasters. 3.3.1 Conduct 10 trainings, which is specifically designed for women and young adults. 3.4.1 To enable CoES focal points to participate in at least two INSARAG events and provide at least one INSARAG related training for the SAR teams. 4.1.1 Agreement on transboundary cooperation in disaster preparedness and response between Tajikistan and Afghanistan signed. 4.2.1 Common procedures for search and rescue operations and integrated command structures for сommon operations between CoES and ANDMA established. 4.3.1 Initiation of construction of two warehouses in Bokhtar and Khorog; 4.3.2 Procurement of NFIs.

1.1.1 Risk assessments conducted in 14 districts and district risk profiles developed. Risk assessment and profiles for 44 districts will be finalized until March 2020. 1.2.1 Based on the result of the feasibility/risk assessment, 11 DRR sub-projects are designed and implementation launched. 1.3.1 Installation of meteorological equipment in 6 weather stations completed and 13 types of measuring tools for 28 weather stations were provided. One week training on weather forecast model was conducted for the Agency on Hydrometeorology staff. 1.4.1 Severe weather warning system identified, and its development is in the process. 2.1.1 DRM improvement plans for Shaartuz and Gharm developed. By the end of March 2020 DRM improvement plans for Bohktar, Kulyab and Khorog will be developed. 2.2.1 Solicitation process for implementation of one project based on Municipality DRM improvement plan of Panjakent is in the process. Negotiation with Khujand authorities on implementation of one project in Khujand is ongoing. 3.1.1 Implementation of the certification process for 10 CBDRM SAR teams, and integration of them into national SAR structure completed. 3.2.1 SAR teams’ capacities and their effectiveness to respond to disasters improved through provision of one vehicle, 128 units (13 types) of equipment and rehabilitation of SAR premises. 3.3.1 10 trainings, which is specifically designed for women and young adults were conducted in synergy with target 3.1.1. 3.4.1 An English course were organized for the SAR teams to improve their English language skills as per the recommendation of INSARAG experts. CoES focal points were registered in OSSOC system where events, meeting and alerts disseminated between USAR teams all over the world. CoES has not expressed interest to participate in any events. 4.1.1 On 21 August 2019, agreement on transboundary cooperation in disaster preparedness and response between Tajikistan and Afghanistan was signed. 4.2.1 Bilateral agreement between Tajikistan and Afghanistan regulates procedures for search and rescue operations between CoES and ANDMA. Assessment of command structure for operations in Tajikistan is in process. 4.3.1 In January and March 2019 construction of two warehouses in Bokhtar and Khorog initiated. 4.3.2 Contract for delivery of NFIs were signed in December 2019 until March 2020.

1.1.1 Risk assessments conducted in 44 districts and district risk profiles developed. 1.2.1 Based on the result of the feasibility/risk assessment, at least 34 DRR sub-projects are designed and implemented. 1.2.2 At least 100,000 seedlings in 250 ha of land planted. 1.3.1 Capacity of Agency on Hydrometeorology on weather data collection improved through installation of high performance computer for weather modelling. 1.4.1 Severe weather warning system developed. 2.1.1 Municipality DRM improvement plans developed for five municipalities (Tursunzade, Jaykhun, Khorog, Kulob, Bokhtar). 2.2.1 Implementation of the municipality DRM improvement plans in at least three municipalities. 3.1.1 Implementation of the certification process for at least 6 CBDRM SAR teams, and initiation of integration process them into national SAR structure. 3.2.1 SAR in Dushanbe SAR teams’ capacities improved and effectively response to disasters. 3.3.1 To enable CoES focal points to participate in at least two INSARAG events and provide at least one INSARAG related training for the SAR teams. 4.1.1 Common procedures for search and rescue operations and integrated command structures for сommon operations between CoES and ANDMA established. 4.2.1 Competing construction of two warehouses in Bokhtar and Khorog. 4.2.2 Deliver NFIs.

Main achievements during 2020. 1.1.1 Risk assessments conducted in all districts finalized and district risk profiles developed. 1.2.2 100,000 seedlings in 274.5 ha of land planted were planted 2.1.1 Municipality DRM improvement plans developed for four municipalities (Tursunzade, Jaykhun, Kulob, Bokhtar). Development of Municipality DRM improvement plan for Khorog was shifted to the next year. 3.1.1 Implementation of the certification process for 6 CBDRM SAR teams in Kushoniyon, Vakhsh, Panj, A. Jomi, Khuroson, Kabodiyon conducted. 3.1.1 Implementation of the certification process for at least 6 CBDRM SAR teams, and initiation of integration process them into national SAR structure. 3.2.1 SAR in Dushanbe SAR teams’ capacities improved and effectively response to disasters through rehabilitation of SAR premises.
Due to COVID-19 pandemic cross border activities and activities which involves international expertise were shifted to the next year. Below activities were shifted to 2021. 1.2.1 Based on the result of the feasibility/risk assessment, at least 34 DRR sub-projects are designed and implemented. 1.3.1 Capacity of Agency on Hydrometeorology on weather data collection improved through installation of high-performance computer for weather modelling. 1.4.1 Severe weather warning system developed. 2.2.1 Implementation of the municipality DRM improvement plans in at least three municipalities. 3.3.1 To enable CoES focal points to participate in at least two INSARAG events and provide at least one INSARAG related training for the SAR teams. 4.1.1 Common procedures for search and rescue operations and integrated command structures for сommon operations between CoES and ANDMA established. 4.2.1 Construction of two warehouses in Bokhtar and Khorog is still pending due to COVID-19 pandemic 4.2.2 Deliver NFIs.

1.1.1 Risk assessments results presented to stakeholders 1.2.1 Capacity of ALRI strengthened and at 30 sub-projects implemented 1.2.2 At least 50,000 seedlings in planted 1.3.1 Capacity of Agency on Hydrometeorology on weather modelling and forecasting improved. 2.1.1 Development of Municipality DRM improvement plan in one district 2.1.2 Awareness campaigns on DRR in at least 5 municipalities to be conducted 2.1.3 Land use planning capacities improved 3.1.1 Establishment/capacity building of at least 10 CBDRM SAR teams 3.2.1 SAR capacities improved through provision of equipment and refurbishment of office 4.1.1 Competing construction of two warehouses in Bokhtar and Khorog and equipping with NFI.

Main achievements during 2021. 1.1.1 Risk assessments results presented and riskinfo.tj portal launched 1.2.1 Technical capacity of ALRI improved through provision of 15 heavy machinery. More than 35 sub-projects were implemented 1.2.2 70,000 seedlings were planted in 217.5 ha of land 1.3.1 Weather modelling and forecasting capacity of AoH improved through provision of equipment and training. 2.1.1 Municipality DRM improvement plan was developed for Gisar town 2.1.2 awareness raising campaigns on DRR and preparedness were conducted in 9 municipalities 2.1.3 The capacities on 9 municipalities on land use planning improved through provision of trainings 3.1.1 In Varzob, Rudaki, Bokhtar, Levakand, Balkhi and Jaykhun 10 CBDRM SAR teams were established and their capacities will be improved through provision of basic SAR equipment 3.2.1 SAR building in Dushanbe was rehabilitated and SAR equipment is beign procured 4.1.1 Construction of two warehouses accomplished and NFI supplied
